definition: Bismarck (name)/Otto von Bismarck (1815-1898), Prussian politician, Minister-President of Prussia 1862-1873, Chancellor of Germany 1871-1890
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

sentences.english: Bismarck was enormously powerful in his 26 years as Prussia's political leader.
sentences.chinese: 在担任普鲁士政治领袖的26年间，俾斯麦位高权重。

sentences.english: The military situation was clearly not disturbing him, and Bismarck was enormously reassured.
sentences.chinese: 战情显然没有令他不安，俾斯麦大感放心了。

sentences.english: This system has elements of both Beveridge and Bismarck.
sentences.chinese: 这个制度的内容具有贝弗里奇和俾斯麦模式的成份。

sentences.english: Bismarck was enormously powerful in his 26 years as Prussia’s political leader.
sentences.chinese: 在担任普鲁士政治领袖的26年间，俾斯麦位高权重。

sentences.english: Bismarch ruled Germany by a strong hand.
sentences.chinese: 俾斯麦用高压手段统治德国。

sentences.english: Bismarck ruled Germany by a strong hand.
sentences.chinese: 俾斯麦用铁腕手段统治德国。

definition: Iron Chancellor, refers to Otto von Bismarck (1815-1898), Prussian politician, minister-president of Prussia 1862-1873, Chancellor of Germany 1871-1890
Charles De Gaulle (1890-1970), French general and politician, leader of the Free French during World War II and president of the Republic 1959-1969
Roosevelt (name)/Theodore Roosevelt (1858-1919), US President 1901-1909/Franklin D. Roosevelt (1882-1945), US President 1933-1945
variant of 拿破崙|拿破仑[Na2 po4 lun2]
Guiseppe Garibaldi (1807-1882), Italian military commander and politician
variant of 邱吉爾|邱吉尔[Qiu1 ji2 er3]
Benito Mussolini (1883-1945), Italian fascist dictator, "Il Duce", president 1922-1943
